meta.title: US Political Self-Insight (8-axis) Question Bank
notes: US-only self-insight instrument designed for a one-page HTML/CSS/JS app.
Each axis has 4 items. Some items are reverse-scored (reverse=true).
Scores can be displayed as a radar/pizza chart (8 axes).

axes.label: Group Hierarchy vs Egalitarianism
axes.low_means: More egalitarian / equality of influence oriented

axes.label: National Identity vs Cosmopolitanism
axes.high_means: More nationalist / cultural preservation / sovereignty oriented

questions.text: The federal government should play a strong role in reducing income inequality.
Free markets, left mostly on their own, produce the best outcomes for society.
Large corporations should be more tightly regulated, even if that slows economic growth.
Government welfare programs usually do more harm than good.
Traditional social values should be upheld, even if society is changing.
Society benefits when people challenge long-standing moral traditions.
Religion should have a greater influence in public life.
Government should stay completely neutral on questions of morality.
Elected officials in Washington mostly serve powerful interests rather than ordinary people.
The will of the majority should not be blocked by courts or bureaucrats.
Complex problems are best handled by experts, even if ordinary citizens disagree.
The country needs leaders who are willing to disrupt the political establishment.
Maintaining law and order is more important than protecting individual civil liberties.
Even offensive or controversial speech should be legally protected.
Police should be given broader powers to prevent crime.
Government surveillance often goes too far in limiting personal freedom.
Some groups of people are naturally more capable of leadership than others.
Society works best when all groups have roughly equal influence.
Efforts to equalize outcomes between groups often go too far.
Government should actively work to reduce disparities between racial and social groups.
Most major American institutions (courts, elections, universities) are fundamentally legitimate.
The federal government is so broken that it needs to be rebuilt from scratch.
Career civil servants generally act in the public interest.
National media organizations are intentionally misleading the public.
Immigration levels should be reduced to preserve American culture.
The U.S. benefits greatly from being deeply involved in international institutions and alliances.
American identity is defined primarily by shared traditions rather than shared ideals.
Being American is mainly about commitment to democratic principles, not cultural background.
Democracy requires protecting minority rights, even when the majority disagrees.
Too much compromise in politics prevents the country from making real progress.
The country would function better if leaders acted decisively instead of negotiating.
A healthy democracy depends on many competing viewpoints.

scoring.interpretation: Higher values indicate more endorsement of the axis label (see axes[].high_means).
